step.name: Locate Element Visually
step.action: Identify the element in the image. Note its approximate position: - Is it in the top quarter? Top third? Top half? Lower portion? - Does it span the full width? Left half? Right half? A column? - What other elements are nearby (above, below, beside)?

step.name: Find Top-Left Corner
step.action: Look at the TOPMOST and LEFTMOST pixel/character of the element. - For text: the first character of the first line - For figures: the top-left corner of the image/chart - For tables: the top-left corner of the outer border Trace to the grid to find the cell at that position. This is your top_left cell (e.g., "B3").

step.name: Find Bottom-Right Corner
step.action: Look at the BOTTOMMOST and RIGHTMOST pixel/character of the element. - For text: the last character of the last line - For figures: the bottom-right corner of the image/chart - For tables: the bottom-right corner of the outer border Trace to the grid to find the cell at that position. This is your bottom_right cell (e.g., "AE12").

step.name: Validate Proportions
step.action: CHECK your coordinates against visual reality: - If element is in top ~25% of page, bottom_right row should be around {quarter_row} - If element is in top ~33% of page, bottom_right row should be around {third_row} - If element is in top ~50% of page, bottom_right row should be around {half_row} - Side-by-side elements should have NON-OVERLAPPING column ranges - Vertically stacked elements should have NON-OVERLAPPING row ranges COMMON ERROR: Including too much whitespace or adjacent elements in the bounding box.
